newsitem.title: LATVIA: BALTICS-BUSINESS NEWSPAPER BALTIC INDEX SET FOR MAY 19.
newsitem.headline: BALTICS-BUSINESS NEWSPAPER BALTIC INDEX SET FOR MAY 19.

text.p: The three leading Baltic business newspapers are to launch a pan-Baltic index of 30 leading shares on May 19, Estonia's business daily Aripaev said on Thursday.

The index will be called the Baltic 30 and has been calculated on a test basis since May 5, a spokesman for Aripaev told Reuters. Latvia's Dienas Bizness and Lithuania's Verslo Zinios are also involved in the compilation of the index.
He would not say which shares were in the index but that the choice had been made to represent various sectors.
Of the stocks only three were bank shares although the top five shares on the stock exchange are banks. Free market companies were also included in the list.
The newspaper index is the first pan-Baltic index. The Estonian and Lithuanian stock exchanges already have their own indices while local banks have calculated them for Latvia.
